instruction: What kind of text should you use in an email to reach out to a potential employer?
output: When sending an email to a potential employer, it is important to make a good first impression. Start by introducing yourself and your background, and be sure to mention why you are interested in the job. Keep your email concise and to the point, providing only the necessary information. Aim for professional, but friendly language that is clear and easy to understand. As applicable, you can also refer to any previous contact or communication you have had with the employer. Finally, be sure to thank them for their time and add your contact information at the end, so they can easily get back to you.
